title: ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in property sheet
OB: The ComboBoxCellEditor in the property sheet does not size correctly when any of the strings in the drop-down list are wider than the width of the property sheet column. The combo box grows to be the width of the largest item, causing the drop-down button to be positioned too far right and off the visible area of the property sheet, resulting in it being clipped.
EB: The ComboBoxCellEditor should size itself based on the available width of the property sheet column, ensuring that the drop-down button remains visible even when the strings in the drop-down list are wider than the column.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the property sheet view. 
2. Navigate to a property that uses a ComboBoxCellEditor as its cell editor. 
3. Ensure that the strings in the drop-down list are wider than the width of the property sheet column. 
4. Observe that the drop-down button is positioned too far right and is partially or fully clipped.
